intro: Mentzelia dispersa var. pinetorum, commonly known as the desert blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils in desert regions. The plant features narrow, bluish-green leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its adaptations include a deep root system to access water and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Mentzelia dispersa var. pinetorum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is part of the Boraginaceae family.
